action.content:
Clarify the meaning of sentences with ambiguous pronouns.

Q: In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: The chief told the counselor that they took the day off.
Options:
(A) The chief took the day off
(B) The counselor took the day off
(C) Ambiguous
A: (A)

Q: In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: The manager sent a message to the secretary, but he didn't reply yet.
Options:
(A) The secretary didn't reply yet
(B) The manager didn't reply yet
(C) Ambiguous
A: (A)

Q: In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: Bailey will plan to meet the director at his office
Options:
(A) It will be Bailey's office
(B) It will be the director's office
(C) Ambiguous
A: (C)

Q: In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: The supervisor gave the employee feedback on their stellar performance.
Options:
(A) It was the supervisor's performance
(B) It was the employee's performance
(C) Ambiguous
A:
action.label: context

action.content:
Q: In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: The team leader made a speech, and the team clapped for them.
Options:
(A) The team leader made a speech, and the team clapped for the team leader
(B) The team leader made a speech, and the team clapped for the team
(C) The team leader made a speech, and the team clapped for the team leader
A: (A) The team leader made a speech, and the team clapped for the team leader
Q: In the following sentences, explain the antecedent of the pronoun (which thing the pronoun refers to), or state that it is ambiguous.
Sentence: The school board member made a motion, and the board member's opponent seconded it.
Options:
(A) The school board member made a motion, and the school board member's opponent seconded it
(B) The school board member made a motion, and the school board member's opponent seconded the motion
(C) The school board member made a motion, and the school board member's opponent seconded the motion
A: (B) The school board member made a motion, and the school board member's opponent seconded the motion
